pages.title: Flame
pages.text: $(bold)TYPE:$() $(l:mechanics/spells_types)Projectile$() $(br)$(bold)COST: Lv1 = $(spell) + Flint and Steel$(br)$(bold)Lv2 = $(spell) + $(#8b2614)Fire Charge$() $(br)$(bold)MAX LEVEL:$() $(#green)2$()$(br)$(bold)XP COST:$() 【 Lv1 = $(#green)8$() 】•【 Lv2 = $(#green)12$()$(br2)$(italic)''Your go-to for combat and cooking food. The flame spell has useful utility within and out of combat''$()

When you cast $(#FF5B0F)$(bold)Flame$(), a fire projectile is cast from your scroll. $(br2)When $(#FF5B0F)$(bold)Flame$() hits an entity, it will be lit on fire. The higher the level of the spell, the longer they will be on fire.$(br2)If the spell hits a block, it will light it on fire, or if it has the ability to be 'lit' (E.g. Campfires), it will light them on fire. $(br2)$(bold)Tip: $(italic)The scroll is a one-time use.$()
